[font=Trebuchet MS][size=medium][color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][IMG]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/396.png[/IMG][/align]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v3/Headlines/iHydra.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]Contracts for Marketplace[/color][/b]
After several years of talks, it's finally happened. The long-announced Vouch system is now live under "Contracts". This replaces reputation in the marketplace and stickies (site-wide). Contracts is early in its current state. It's working though Xerotic and Omniscient continue to improve it. MyCode has been added after launch along with a "Contracted Customer" label by posts in threads who've completed a contract with the thread owner. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5847086] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Reputation Deleted[/color][/b]
With Contracts enabled for the marketplace, reputation across the site has been fully reset for all members.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5847386] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Canned Reputation[/color][/b]
Reputation no longer is custom text. You can now only give canned reputation or pre-defined reputation. You have a dropdown with several positive, neutral, and negative reputation to choose from.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5847699] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Ub3r Suspended[/color][/b]
Ub3r is closed for applications and will no longer accept new members. Omniscient has stated a new group will launch to replace Ub3r and all current members will stay. Nothing concrete on if members can leave Ub3r for the new group but we'll report on anything further.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5849002] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]r00t Group[/color][/b]
Teased with a userbar and award, the next group will be called r00t and will take the spot of Ub3r. It's designed to be an automatic approval process and not manual. It will either have the same features and privileges as Ub3r or more than what Ub3r provides.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5850367] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Importance of SEO[/color][/b]
Once again, Omniscient talks about how vital SEO and mobile-ready optimizations are for Hack Forums' future. Google ranks mobile-first, mobile-ready websites above all others and it is hurting Hack Forums for not being mobile-ready. Effort is being put towards a new mobile-friendly theme. More updates to come.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5851032] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Post Reputations[/color][/b]
Post Reputations were enabled briefly but now disabled once again. Omniscient will reconsider adding it back after adjustments are made. Post Reputations allowed members to rep a single member multiple times for a unique, specific post each time. Omniscient did not like the idea of multiple reps at a "spam" level and will reconsider adjusting or never enabling it.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5851974] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Stress and Patience[/color][/b]
Omniscient goes over what has been going over in his life at home and with his family. Asks for patience and for everyone to give the Staff team time to continue working on new changes and adjusting them before jumping on the hate train. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5850705] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Rep4Rep Doesn't Excuse LQP[/color][/b]
There's been loads of members low quality posting around the forums. This is not allowed, LQP is LQP even if you can now ask for reputation. You still cannot have profile goals ("Road to 100 Rep!!"), you cannot spam in PMs, nor make threads offering Rep4Rep or anything alike. Doing so will result in a long ban. Staff and moderators have been instructed to close and warn all members doing so and Omniscient has been banning members left and right for LQP.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5847963] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b]There was a lot of news this past week. These are the main core ones. There are smaller details within each thread. View Omniscient's posts to read thru the smaller details.[/b] 

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[color=1E90FF][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389]Meow[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=][align=left]

[hr]

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: Hello Meow. Thank you for your time. Let's get started.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389][color=#74c239][b]Meow[/b][/color][/url]: Let's go. Thank you for having me.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: Per the usual, any shoutouts?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389][color=#74c239][b]Meow[/b][/color][/url]: That is what I was waiting for, s/o to Trappy, Riyu, Slade, Shay, Woods (10%), Vyrez, American Chief, Big fella C, Novica, everyone in the discord & HF gang. That should be it. O yeah, also shoutout to Shane/Soup, hopefully he comes back since he did killer thread designs Â ðŸ˜µ

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: Cool, nice shoutout list.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389][color=#74c239][b]Meow[/b][/color][/url]: Fuck, also shoutout to everyone who was in Revolution

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: Ah yes, can't forget the group shoutouts! So you've been on Hack Forums for almost 6 years now. "Oldfag" confirmed! 8.21 posts/day with a total of 17,037 posts.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389][color=#74c239][b]Meow[/b][/color][/url]: It would've been a lot more PPD but I took like two 6 month bans

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: Let's talk a little about the earlier years of Hack Forums. What were some memories of Hack Forums back in the early days.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389][color=#74c239][b]Meow[/b][/color][/url]: Â I wasn't very active on HF until maybe 2013, mostly during the summer. Before that I just made account and posted maybe once a week or so. Some of my oldest memories would be Vinnie, Tinychat, Instinct (v1), and all that shit. Back when Roger Waters was in his "prime" and HF was.. booming, at least that's how I remember it. Back when..when.. Sir was handling the news

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: Roger Waters ðŸ˜­ Vinnie ðŸ˜­ What were your focused topics. I see that you're mostly invested in the marketplace which we'll talk more about towards the end, did you always focus on marketplace or had other interests?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389][color=#74c239][b]Meow[/b][/color][/url]: No no, marketplace was out of question until summer of 2017 or so. Back when I joined HF I was looking for uh facebook hacker, now that I think about it it was so cringe, I can't even believe it. After discovering you can't magically hack an account with some visual basic "hacker" (read: keylogger/RAT), I expanded my interest in helping members in free graphics section, shitposting in lounge & checking SST section here and there. I imagine some of the newer members don't even remember SST

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: Yep, Server Stress Testing (SST) is no longer a forum along with a few other forums that were retired over the years. It was indeed a popular one much like how the marketplace is now. I remember joining for hacking but quickly changed focus towards design and gaming - it's a very common event many members go through.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389][color=#74c239][b]Meow[/b][/color][/url]: Most definitely, after some time you realize you can't just steal someones password by downloading some weird tool from a random person off the internet/forum

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: So you joined Hack Forums for a tool that can hack into Facebook accounts. Was "Meow" your first username? Why did you end up going with that?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389][color=#74c239][b]Meow[/b][/color][/url]: Nah, my first name was some weird shit I used everywhere, can't even remember it rn. I do remember changing my name to "MeowImCat", shortly after purchasing l33t upgrade. Later I went with "Meow" and the reason for it was very simple. Around that time my cat died, it was very unfortunate series of events and I probably could've saved her but I guess it's too late for that now & I don't really want to go into details. As a big cat lover I went with simple name "Meow". I first wanted to use "Cat" but that would sound like im some catfish or some shit, and "Meow" sounds awesome when you say it. I wouldn't want people to call me Cat in voice chat, lmao

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: Glad you decided to go with "Meow" and not "Cat." That would've been weird indeed. Sad to hear about your cat.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389][color=#74c239][b]Meow[/b][/color][/url]: Told you

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: You shouted out Instinct and Revolution, where you big in the group scene?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389][color=#74c239][b]Meow[/b][/color][/url]: Not really, I liked both groups because they were chill af. I don't even have to mention Instinct with Vinnie on board, that was some next level shit. Sad to see that most Instinct members are now inactive or closed. As for Revolution, that was probably the best group I was ever in, fuck I was even leader of it. I used to refresh Revolution lounges every 10 minutes, even when I was with my friends out. I wouldn't consider myself being big in group scene, I was a leader of a few groups and I was maybe in 15-20 different groups throughout my HF journey, not that much considering I was on HF since 2013. I also really liked The Order, I guess every summer had it's own group that made it memorable

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: It's good to be in a group you enjoy greatly, the experience is very enjoyable. I've had my fair share as well. Memories are built within those groups. Moving on, what year would you define as your "peak" and why?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389][color=#74c239][b]Meow[/b][/color][/url]: When I was leader of Revolution, for sure. Everything was where it was supposed to be at that point in my life, both in HF and IRL. I've met a lot of friends through that timespan, mostly to which I talk to this day and I'm very happy & proud of that. I believe this summer is going to be new peak so if you were to ask me that question 6 months from now, I'd probably say that my peak was at this point.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: Maybe we'll interview you in 6 months Â ðŸ™‚ 
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389][color=#74c239][b]Meow[/b][/color][/url]: I'm down, if I don't get closed or something in the mean time

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: Haha, hope not. Not many "OG's" left. So for the rest of the interview, I'd like to discuss the marketplace a bit in-depth. You have experience with the marketplace on Hack Forums and would be nice to get your opinion on the latest changes. Â So with the original reputation system, do you believe it was flawed for the marketplace? Is the new contracts system something you're interested in?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389][color=#74c239][b]Meow[/b][/color][/url]: If I could sum up all the changes in 1 word, it would be "questionable". Latest marketplace changes are definitely questionable, in my opinion, of course. I do understand what Omni is trying to do but I believe those things were long overdue, especially the contracts system. Â  I think reputation was perfect, i'd personally just change some rules regarding DWC reps and things like that but I believe reputation system was a perfect fit for HF overall, marketplace included. I trusted reputation when deciding if I was going to deal with that member or not, now I just play it safe and deal with guys I've been dealing with for years, mostly currency exchangers such as Woods or Danny Khalifa. I understand that rep reset gave everyone a fresh start, and by everyone I mean scammers as well. With only UID exposing them as scammers, which most member have no idea what it is, it was a perfect time for 'known' scammers to get back in and scam some money. Contracts system is still new and not a lot of members know how to use it, me included. I think Xerotic, Omniscient and whoever was working on that feature had to first code, build and check everything before releasing it for the public. I mean, they added contracts and they weren't even working for the first 24 hours. Now I do understand you have to be objective in these kinds of interviews, especially since it's HF news but I definitely think all of this should've played out differently, from reputation reset to contracts. But hey, who am I to say how is one supposed to run a decade old forum & community?

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: Do you believe over time Contracts will age into a better reputation system? Or would you rather get reputation only back (assume full reset still).
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389][color=#74c239][b]Meow[/b][/color][/url]: Doubt it, too much work involved. I have to go thru 4 different pages and confirm the deal like 3 times before I actually confirm it. It's not very user friendly, at least not for now.. I guess. There is no point in even only getting rep back (reseted rep) because of canned rep. I can't warn anyone not to deal with a specific member, but then again.. there is contract system for that. Members are forced to use contract system now that rep is basically gone. I have no idea if that was Omni's plan at first but I think this would've played out a lot better if it was done earlier, maybe in 2012-2013, not now in mid 2018. Only time will tell.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: Yep, Omniscient talked about a "Vouch System" and wanted to do it but never got the chance till now it seems. Xerotic being an Admin of Hack Forums has sped up development of plugins and features, takes off some work load from Omniscient.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389][color=#74c239][b]Meow[/b][/color][/url]: : I am not going to comment on that since it's very sensitive topic, a few people could get angry but again.. I would definitely do some things differently. However, big props to Xerotic for actually doing all of that, from new buy sticky page to contracts, you can clearly see he is pouring his heart & soul into it, and obviously his time.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: No worries. Risks of marketplace are mainly scams and fraud, would you agree? Do you think the risk is significant or it's an issue that's blown out of proportion?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389][color=#74c239][b]Meow[/b][/color][/url]: Most definitely. I can't wake up and not see at least one new thread in deal disputes section where another fellow member got scammed. I think there should be some punishments for scammers, either by banning them, post banning them, closing them, or whatever. I do understand staff do not get involved in deal disputes but we've seen many times that members with 10+ scam reports scam for for literally $5, usually from new members who simply do not understand how this site works. Maybe a member should make an updated in-depth thread on how to safely deal in HF marketplace and Omniscient could include a link to it in welcome email and/or PM, so new members can see what's going on here. There will always be scammers and members who turn rouge, either by scamming, chargebacking or doing some kind of fraud. Risk is always there, it's up to us to do the work and carefully consider if we're 100% sure we want to deal with another member, with or without middleman.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: Just a couple more questions to go...
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389][color=#74c239][b]Meow[/b][/color][/url]: Sure

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: Do you like the current structure of the subforums in the marketplace? Would you like to see more subforums or any removal?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389][color=#74c239][b]Meow[/b][/color][/url]: I believe subforums are good the way they are, maybe I'd bring back SST but that's about it. There is a section for everything, from ebooks, premium tools & programs, auctions, accounts, etc.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: Earlier you said you got into the marketplace in 2017. What's your opinion on the progression of the marketplace over the year? Has it improved, has it become more active, loss of interest?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389][color=#74c239][b]Meow[/b][/color][/url]: It seems like a lot of the activity fell down, except currency exchange section. I'd imagine that members feel somewhat scared purchasing anything from the marketplace since there is no real guarantee they'll get what they pay for, especially since staff don't get involved in deal disputes. I can also see that NFA section improved a lot in the activity, looks like a lot of members like to Netflix & Chill here and there.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: Alrighty then, well that's all I have for you today. Thank you for spending the extra time to do an interview for the HF News. Appreciate it. If there's anything else you'd like to say, now is the time.  ðŸ™‚ 
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1500389][color=#74c239][b]Meow[/b][/color][/url]: Well, now that asking for rep is allowed.. I guess I could ask members to +rep me?  ðŸ˜ˆ Â All in all, thank you for having me, I'm very happy that you chose to interview me this week and I'm happy that you guys are (hopefully) bringing back longer editions.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#558ad8][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url]: Yep, we were testing two short editions with core sections only. We're returning back to normal long editions for Edition 396. Thanks again, have a good one!

[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[hr]

[b][color=white]Recruitment Update[/color][/b]
Will be contacting people this week. If you aren't contacted after Friday, that means you didn't make the cut. We had only a few slots available but once more open up, we'll open up for recruitment again. Thank you for your interest.

[b][color=white]Development[/color][/b]
A few goodies in the works. Interview will be out 6/20/2018. Avatar should be enough to know who's the interviewee. A rewards program is in the works. Contest is nearly ready to launch.

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3322334][img]https://i.imgur.com/H5MRIbN.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]The Brain Prefers Chocolate to Cheese[/color][/b] 
We all know that the body prefers fatty foods to their more lean and healthy brethren. Dana Small, who is attending Yale University, had their participants bid imaginary currency on particular food items. While this auction was happening, regular scans of the brains revealed that much more of the brain was alight with activity when considering what to bid on a slice of cake compared to any other item on offer, such as cheese. This is just one of the ways those of us on strict diets have to overcome the way our brains are programmed to continue to eat healthily. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-018-05441-1]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]The More Mindful, the Better[/color][/b] 
Researchers at Virginia Commonwealth University have had a look into how being mindful of others can help reduce the sting of social rejection. "Social rejection can have a number of negative outcomes both for the rejected person's health and well-being, as well as their interpersonal relationships," said lead author Alexandra Martelli on the many side effects. They tested this by running an experiment on 40 participants. It began by having these participants self-report their perceived levels of mindfulness. They then were placed in a fMRI machine while playing a game of throwing a ball back and forth. They all took part in three rounds., with less and less passes to them each time being used to simulate social rejection. The readings from the fMRI machines clearly show that those who identified as more mindful had much less severe of a reaction to the simulated rejection. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2018-06/vcu-sri061418.php]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/lv4d7BY.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Trump threatens to end all trade with allies[/color][/b] 
On 9 June 2018, President Trump attended the G7 summit with fellow allies. Prior to leaving, Trump â€œsaid that the U.S. might end all trade with Americaâ€™s closest allies if those countries donâ€™t submit to his demands over reduced trade barriers.â€ Additionally, Trump confirmed rumors about talks regarding tariffs with Britain, France, Germany, Japan, Canada, and Italy, stating that â€œthere should be no tariffs between them and the U.S. of any kind.â€ Trump has used hyperbolic threats in the past to pursue a decision in his favor; however, it is unknown if this is another instance, or if the president will stick by his word. Another concerning matter will be if the countriesâ€™ leaders will take this threat seriously. Trump has been extremely outspoken about trade with the United Nations, most commonly claiming that the United States is treated unfairly â€“ this is another instance of that. President Trump calls this situation â€˜ridiculous and unfair,â€™ in regard to the current import tariffs placed on the U.S. from the allied countries. Trump referred to the United States as â€˜the piggy bank that everybody is robbing,â€™ and wrapping the statement up with â€˜that ends.â€™ At this moment, answers are up in the air, seeing that, by the looks of it, the battle on tariffs is Trump vs. the West. [i][size=x-small][url=http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2018/06/trump-threatens-to-end-all-trade-with-allies.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Kim commits to 'complete denuclearization' after summit[/color][/b] 
History was made last week. On Tuesday, 12 June 2018, President Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un officially met in Singapore for the first summit ever held by the two countries, coincidingly. A surplus of topics was discussed; however, the one on everybodyâ€™s mind was that of denuclearizing North Korea. In a joint text released by the two leaders, Kim â€œhas committed to â€˜complete denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula.â€™â€ The historic document was signed by the two after their meeting in Singapore had concluded on Tuesday. In a statement by Trump, he describes the document as â€˜comprehensiveâ€™ and the denuclearization process as beginning â€˜very quickly.â€™ To ensure the American people that he instills faith in this document, the statement said â€˜President Trump committed to provide security guarantees to the DPRK, and Chairman Kim Jong-un reaffirmed his firm and unwavering commitment to complete denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula.â€™ 

Per SBS News, here are several affirmations that Trump states that the United States and North Korea will continue to work on in the foreseeable future:
[list]
[*]The United States and the DPRK commit to establish new U.S.-DPRK relations in accordance with the desire of the peoples of the two countries for peace and prosperity.
[*]The United States and the DPRK will join their efforts to build a lasting and stable peace regime on the Korean Peninsula.
[*]Reaffirming the April 27, 2018 Panmunjom Declaration, the DPRK commits to work towards complete denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula.
[*]The United States and the DPRK commit to recovering POW/MIA remains, including the immediate repatriation of those already identified. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.sbs.com.au/news/kim-commits-to-complete-denuclearisation-after-summit]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]
[/list]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/uVQrGNh.png[/img][/align]
[b][color=white]Devil May Cry 5 Will Be out Before April Next Year[/color][/b] 
A lot of interesting games were announced at this year's E3 event in LA this year. DMC 5 plans on hitting stores next year in the springtime. The game will be created by capcom, and the E3 trailer can be seen [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KMSGj9Y2T9Q]here[/url]. Most likely the game will be released at the end of March, rumors report. In the game, you will be able to play as three different characters, and if you enjoyed the previous games, you will enjoy this sequel. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.pcgamer.com/devil-may-cry-5-will-be-out-before-end-of-march-next-year/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Black Ops 4's Dlc Maps Are Locked in a Season Pass[/color][/b] 
CoD fans are not too pleased to hear that the only way to get access to Black Ops 4 DLC is by purchasing the season pass. In the past CoD games, a season pass was available for a hefty price, but that price was definitely worth it for die-hard CoD gamers. The pass allowed for all DLC's added to the game to be essentially free (you had paid for them with the big price of the pass) and there were options to just purchase certain DLC packs that you wanted so that you could skip out on ones you may not be interested in. How do you think this will impact the community? PCGamer states that they believe it will split the community in two. The first DLC being added to a game that is not even released yet plans on including a new zombie map, four exclusive characters, and 12 multiplayer maps. Without being bias, the game has been going downhill, and the ratings have not been as great as they were in the past. However, PCGamer might be correct when they say that it will split the community. Will those willing to pay have a better experience? The pass for Blops 4 will be anywhere around $40-$100; the price has not been announced yet. If you did not know already, the game will have no singleplayer, so purchasing the DLC will impact your multiplayer and zombie experience only. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.pcgamer.com/black-ops-4s-dlc-maps-are-locked-in-a-season-pass-and-players-arent-happy/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]PUBG[/color][/b] 
Not being a fan of the desert map in PUBG, Miramar, has been a debate among the players who frequent the game. Some love the map, while others think that it is too big or that there is not enough action that goes on in that particular map, as opposed to the first original map, Erangel. Back in an update in April, players were now allowed to choose which map they wanted to queue up for. This allowed you to choose both maps or one of your favorites. With the addition of the newest map, Sanhok, that has been being tested on for a while on the PUBG test servers, once it hits the main servers map selection will be scaled back. What this means is that you most likely will not have the feature to select your favorite maps, or amount of times you play on the map you selected is reduced. This is to make the game flow perfectly and allow for anyone in a long queue to find a game faster. PUBG states that with more than two maps, they will have to reduce the map selection feature with the explanation given before that it will help queue times. In other news, a newer map than Sanhok has been announced. Back during the early versions of the game, there were discussions of different weather types. Since then, rain, fog, and hail were removed. However, there will now be a new map that will be during the winter. The official PUBG Twitter [url=https://twitter.com/PUBG/status/1005914574963347457?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.pcgamer.com%2Fpubgs-winter-map-will-be-somewhere-between-miramar-and-sanhok-in-size%2F]tweeted[/url] out a gif with the caption, "Coming Winter 2018." There is really not much information known. That being said, we will not know completely just yet if the map will have a constant snowfall, but it is confirmed that snow will be on the ground. Lastly, the map size has not been confirmed yet, however, we do know it will not be a 8x8 map and it will not be a 4x4 like Sanhok. [i][size=x-small][url=https://pastebin.com/JmCyYWj6]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Fortnite[/color][/b] 
Fortnite is one hell of a popular game. So popular that an event was hosted during Fortnite's E3 panel this past week. This is how the event went down. 50 celebrities and 50 pro-fortnite players teamed up together in a duo match in a LAN party at a sports stadium. The event was hosted at the Banc Stadium, where the Los Angeles FC play. The winning duo of the event is able to donate $1 million to the charity of their choice. If you are curious to know who was on what team, you can take a look [url=https://www.polygon.com/2018/6/1/17417568/fortnite-e3-tournament-teams-players-ninja-ali-a]here[/url]. If you have not heard already, the ex-pro Halo player and popular streamer Ninja won the event with his partner Marshmello. The event got the attention of over 700,000 people on the gaming streaming website, Twitch. That being said, it broke the most views ever on a live stream, beating Ninja who had over 660,000 during his Vegas Fortnite event months ago. One thing to note is that the money earned from winning this little event does not come from the $100 million prize-pool that can be earned during Fortnite's first competitive event. [i][size=x-small][url=https://pastebin.com/BDTucFia]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Steam[/color][/b] 
Achievement hunting has always been a well-known thing if you are a gamer. Some of us have even tried it ourselves, and others commit to it and are die-hard achievement hunters for life. Sad news for those who use Steam to purchase their computer games. It may not be a huge deal for those who do not like to earn achievements so easily and like a challenge, but for those who want easy achievements at a decent price, this will definitely affect you. Last year, Valve added a system so that cards were not given to players until the computer thought a real person was playing the game and deserved to earn it. The same system is being implemented, but instead of card drops, it will be for achievements. Achievement farming games are not really that popular when it comes to Steam. Unlike the trophy and gamerscore system on PS and Xbox, achievements do not really mean much on the PC. However, many people like to unlock achievements to make their profile pages look pretty. A [url=https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/BtaePXCTVkj5kF8qU9EsLb-650-80.jpg]picture[/url] from PCGamer.com shows us what new games that are being added to Steam will have. You will notice in the picture linked that it says, "Steam is still learning about this game." It then gives a little more information on what this means. Some good news to come out from Valve and Steam is that the platform will officially be legal in China soon enough. This means no more workarounds or exploits to use the service, and those in China will be able to have a legitimate copy of the application installed on their computer. Valve is coming together with Perfect World Co, a Chinese gaming company, to release the app for Chinese residents. With the help of Perfect World Co, Chinese players can now be part of the Steam world. Because of the huge Chinese audience when it comes to gaming, this will definitely be an increase in profit for both companies. There will be limitations on what the players can do. For example, they will be allowed to access the store of course to purchase games, but forums, discussions, and access to their own profiles (yeah, that is way too much) will not be accessible. There is no information on limitation of games or if China will have access to all games. [i][size=x-small][url=https://pastebin.com/4WHkvh5z]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]
